movie.title: 28 Up
movie.description_intro: Director Michael Apted revisits the same group of British-born adults after a 7 year wait. The subjects are interviewed as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.
movie.description_full: Director Michael Apted revisits the same group of British-born adults after a 7 year wait. The subjects are interviewed as to the changes that have occurred in their lives during the last seven years.

movies.title: Wittgenstein
movies.summary: A dramatization, in modern theatrical style, of the life and thought of the Viennese-born, Cambridge-educated philosopher Ludwig Wittgenstein (1889-1951), whose principal interest was the nature and limits of language. A series of sketches depict the unfolding of his life from boyhood, through the era of the first World War, to his eventual Cambridge professorship and association with Bertrand Russell and John Maynard Keynes. The emphasis in these sketches is on the exposition of the ideas of Wittgenstein, a homosexual, and an intuitive, moody, proud, and perfectionistic thinker generally regarded as a genius.

movies.title: The People Vs. Fritz Bauer
movies.summary: The story of the man who brought high-ranking German Nazi criminal Adolf Eichmann to justice.
movies.description_full: The story of the man who brought high-ranking German Nazi criminal Adolf Eichmann to justice.
movies.synopsis: The story of the man who brought high-ranking German Nazi criminal Adolf Eichmann to justice.

movies.title: Daffodils
movies.summary: A bittersweet love story told with beautiful re-imaginings of iconic New Zealand songs.
movies.description_full: A bittersweet love story told with beautiful re-imaginings of iconic New Zealand songs.
movies.synopsis: A bittersweet love story told with beautiful re-imaginings of iconic New Zealand songs.

movies.title: Hunger
movies.summary: Hunger follows life in the Maze Prison, Northern Ireland with an interpretation of the highly emotive events surrounding the 1981 IRA Hunger Strike, led by Bobby Sands. With an epic eye for detail, the film provides a timely exploration of what happens when body and mind are pushed to the uttermost limit.
